message: I've got an original Lego Mindstorms Yellow kit and NXT 2.0.  If someone was interested in borrowing this for exploration or a school robotics event or activity just ask.
@Ponderings Wondering what you think of the Mindstorms kit--for example do you find it very limited, is it easy to work with, etc?

@kctheswan Frankly, the "Graphical Programming" interface stopped me dead in my tracks, and there was a lot of other noise in my thinking/working space at the time and I shelved it until I had a moment of inspiration.  I've got a dedicated computer with bluetooth for it now so have no excused other than time and space, and this spring has been focused on making space.  Halfway there :)
I've very interested in hearing about it. I remember playing with an early version in the mid 90's. That was pretty clunky.
